text:
<@UMCBG6QK0> The product and line item properties are not visible under HubSpot properties section but yes when creating out lists in HubSpot we can use product and line item properties. Also if you are testing out what exact fields exist for these objects then you can use `Get all CRM properties` 
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-properties/get-properties>

For HubSpot embed, I am trying to change the submit button text during the global event "onFormReady", but it goes unchanged. It also seems to reset the submit text when there's a change in the form.  Is there another way to change submit button text during the "onFormReady"?
I am able to change the submit text when i create an event listener on the form, but it doesn't change the text on initial load.
if you're using jQuery be sure you use `.val('text here')` instead of `.text('text here')`
because the submit is an `input`, not a `button`.
I have done so, but it still doesn't work...
This is what I'm using `$('input[type="submit"]').val("Changing").trigger('change');` or `$('input[type="submit"]').val("Changing").change();`
try `$('input[type="submit"]')` in the console just to make sure you are dealing with a submit input.
so i put a debugger at the end of my code in the "onFormReady" event and it seems to change it, but on the HS side it changes it back to default submit text once i hit play.
<@ULGQ03PT9> BTW. you can hide the default button and add your own and it will still submit the form.
<@U38EZFVFE> interesting.. that does not seem ideal, but looks like it works.  thanks!  Do you think that this behavior is intentional?
Well they use react to control state changes which is why the `.change()` should have worked but this is a work around i have used in the past.
